content.question: Which of the following is an appropriate null hypothesis for the studentâ€™s experiment?

choices.label: The absence of light negatively affects the mass of the grass.
An increase in light promotes grass growth.
A change in light intensity changes the rate of grass growth.
The presence of light has no effect on the mass of the grass.

content.answer: The presence of light has no effect on the mass of the grass.

skill.text: 3.B: State the null hypothesis or predict the results of an experiment.
